CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 25, 1950, pg. 4, reads: "Convicted Slayer - Ollie Strickland, 37-year-old Georgia worker, ducks the camera as he is led from Judge J. Frank Graff's courtroom Tuesday. Strickland pleaded guilty to the knife slaying of his wife, Ovie, last Sept. 24, in a Hill District room when she refused to accompany him back to Georgia.  Judge Graff fixed the crime at second-degree murder and sentenced Strickland to the Western Penitentiary for ten to twenty years.  (Insert) Mabel Jean Strickland, daughter of the dead woman, snarls at the cameraman as her picture is snapped.  She came from Decatur, Ga., with a brother, Ollie Jr., to testify against her father whom she described as "dangerous and vicious." -Teenie Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group of man, possibly Ollie Strickland, Jr., and six women, including Mabel Jean Strickland standing in profile wearing dark coat with fur collar, standing in Allegheny Courthouse
